commands.dailystandupreport¶

Classes¶

DailyStandupReport

This class schedules and sends daily standup reports of tasks via Slack.

Module Contents¶

class commands.dailystandupreport.DailyStandupReport(app, channel_id)[source]¶

This class schedules and sends daily standup reports of tasks via Slack.

Why: Useful for teams who want an automated daily update on tasks, making it easy to track progress, manage upcoming deadlines, and keep the team aligned on outstanding tasks directly within Slack.

How: Common usage examples: 1. DailyStandupReport.schedule_daily_report(report_time=”09:00”): Set up a daily schedule to automatically send reports. 2. DailyStandupReport.send_daily_report(): Manually trigger sending the daily report. 3. DailyStandupReport.get_standup_message(users): Generate a message summarizing tasks for each user.

block_format[source]¶
scheduler[source]¶
app[source]¶
channel_id[source]¶
schedule_daily_report(report_time='09:00')[source]¶

Schedules the daily standup report to be sent at the specified time each day.

Parameters:

report_time (str) – Time in ‘HH:MM’ format when the report should be sent.

Returns:

None

Why: Automates the daily reporting process by setting a schedule for sending reports, reducing the need for manual reminders. How: Example usage - ` standup_reporter.schedule_daily_report(report_time="08:30") `

get_standup_message(users)[source]¶

Compiles a daily standup message with each user’s task status.

Parameters:

users (list of User objects) – List of users to include in the report.

Returns:

A formatted string representing the standup report.

Return type:

str

Why: Provides a consolidated message of each user’s task status, covering recently completed, upcoming, and past-due tasks. How: Example usage - ` message = standup_reporter.get_standup_message(users) `

send_daily_report()[source]¶

Compiles and sends the daily standup report to the designated Slack channel.

Why: This method directly executes the report generation and sending process, ideal for manual or scheduled execution. How: Example usage - ` standup_reporter.send_daily_report() `

post_to_slack(report_payload)[source]¶

Sends the standup report to a specified Slack channel.

Parameters:

report_payload (dict) – The payload of the report in Slack-compatible format.

Returns:

None

Why: Allows the report to be delivered directly within a Slack channel, ensuring visibility and accessibility for the team. How: Example usage - ` report_payload = {"text": {"text": "Sample report"}} standup_reporter.post_to_slack(report_payload) `
